items.title: Product Tester from Home (Part-time). No Exp. Required, $25-$45/hr. - Clayton
items.content:
In-Home Usage Tester (Product Tester from home) Part-time

Presently we're recruiting Product Testers (from home) in several US cities to expand our private network of In-Home Usage Testers (IHUT) to fulfill upcoming contracts with national and international companies. We guarantee 15-20 hours per week with an hourly pay of between $25/hr. and $45/hr., depending on the In-Home Usage Test project. No experience required.
American Consumer Panels is a consulting firm that specializes in product testing and product development work. We design and conduct In-Home Usage Testing (IHUT) locally and nationally to provide actual user feedback to companies and market research firms to evaluate products, packaging, related product instructions and more.
We leverage our network of private panels (In-Home Usage Testers) to provide product testers to companies for evaluating the in-home experience with a wide variety of products to ensure proper product certification and greater market access.
Please note that although this job can be done from home 95% of the time, very occasionally In-Home Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings (visits are local and scheduled at no more than 20 minutes drive from the In-Home Usage Tester address). These optional visits are also paid by the hour.
During your application process, we will determine your consumer profile and establish what products would be suitable for you to test according to your demographics, lifestyle, consumer behavior, skills, hobbies and ability. Research questionnaires are used to identify and target certain types of consumers, to ensure the right participants are engaged and to achieve the representative sample needed. Job candidates for In-Home Usage Testing are also screened to meet the client s needs for the project to ensure that the product is one that they qualify to test and that they have a balance of demographics and attitudes.
Participation in these product testing and consumer panels is always free, secure and private. In-Home Usage Testing is a quick, easy and fun way to make extra cash by telling big brands what you think about their upcoming products and services in the American market.

Main duties:
Sign and return non-disclosure agreements before the product to be tested is shipped. Individuals who complete the required documents will have the products sent to their homes.
Once the product is received for In-Home Usage Test (IHUT), the Product Tester must take care of the product being tested and use it responsibly.
Read and strictly follow the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule provided with each product testing project. In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedules may include tasks to do such as: unpacking, reading instructions, journal entries, online or mobile feedback, usage of product for certain amount of time, writing reviews, taking pictures, etc.
Properly document In-Home Usage Test as instructed in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule. Types of documentation commonly used for In-Home Usage Tests are snapshots, audio recordings, videos and Product Journals.
Attend Skype meetings or conference call meetings with Account Managers, Brand Managers, Research Managers, Product Managers or small business owners to offer ongoing product usage feedback. These short virtual meetings may take place 2-3 times per week and are paid by the hour also.
Some In-Home Usage Tests projects may require participants to use MFour s Mobile In-Home Use Test Technology (cutting edge smartphone technology to capture Point-of-Emotion insights to gain unparalleled depth of responses).
Paid Product Testing is done from home 95% of the time, but very occasionally paid Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings. These visits are paid by the hour also.
There are times when the product testing may be discussed in a private chat room that is opened by the market research group.
Write reviews as requested in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule for each project.
Review requirements can vary, however, the standard requirement is a written review, photos of the reviewer with the product and a video review.

Requirements:
Great ability to follow precise instructions
Be open to write short reviews, record audio or short video (doesn't have to be perfect), no experience needed
Great attention to detail and curious spirit
Be able to work 15-20 hours per week and commit to a certain routine
Have access to a computer and a reliable internet connection
Have access to a digital camera or cellphone that takes pictures
Be honest and reliable
Good communication skills is an asset
No experience required
High School Diploma
18 years or older

A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for an entry level opportunity or for seasonal work, temporary work or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible and no previous experience is necessary. Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistant. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker or intern who is looking for a flexible part time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. Also if you have been involved in accounting, clerical jobs, marketing, management, security or data entry jobs you may qualify for a paid product tester position.

Benefits:
Very competitive salary
Weekly pay
Work around your schedule
Learn about an exciting industry
Telecommute (you can work from home, work or school)
Most of the time you can keep the product tested
An incredible team comprised of motivated and talented individuals


To apply please follow this link:

items.content:
In-Home Usage Tester (Product Tester from home) Part-time

Presently we're recruiting Product Testers (from home) in several US cities to expand our private network of In-Home Usage Testers (IHUT) to fulfill upcoming contracts with national and international companies. We guarantee 15-20 hours per week with an hourly pay of between $25/hr. and $45/hr., depending on the In-Home Usage Test project. No experience required.
American Consumer Panels is a consulting firm that specializes in product testing and product development work. We design and conduct In-Home Usage Testing (IHUT) locally and nationally to provide actual user feedback to companies and market research firms to evaluate products, packaging, related product instructions and more.
We leverage our network of private panels (In-Home Usage Testers) to provide product testers to companies for evaluating the in-home experience with a wide variety of products to ensure proper product certification and greater market access.
Please note that although this job can be done from home 95% of the time, very occasionally In-Home Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings (visits are local and scheduled at no more than 20 minutes drive from the In-Home Usage Tester address). These optional visits are also paid by the hour.
During your application process, we will determine your consumer profile and establish what products would be suitable for you to test according to your demographics, lifestyle, consumer behavior, skills, hobbies and ability. Research questionnaires are used to identify and target certain types of consumers, to ensure the right participants are engaged and to achieve the representative sample needed. Job candidates for In-Home Usage Testing are also screened to meet the client s needs for the project to ensure that the product is one that they qualify to test and that they have a balance of demographics and attitudes.
Participation in these product testing and consumer panels is always free, secure and private. In-Home Usage Testing is a quick, easy and fun way to make extra cash by telling big brands what you think about their upcoming products and services in the American market.

Main duties:
Sign and return non-disclosure agreements before the product to be tested is shipped. Individuals who complete the required documents will have the products sent to their homes.
Once the product is received for In-Home Usage Test (IHUT), the Product Tester must take care of the product being tested and use it responsibly.
Read and strictly follow the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule provided with each product testing project. In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedules may include tasks to do such as: unpacking, reading instructions, journal entries, online or mobile feedback, usage of product for certain amount of time, writing reviews, taking pictures, etc.
Properly document In-Home Usage Test as instructed in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule. Types of documentation commonly used for In-Home Usage Tests are snapshots, audio recordings, videos and Product Journals.
Attend Skype meetings or conference call meetings with Account Managers, Brand Managers, Research Managers, Product Managers or small business owners to offer ongoing product usage feedback. These short virtual meetings may take place 2-3 times per week and are paid by the hour also.
Some In-Home Usage Tests projects may require participants to use MFour s Mobile In-Home Use Test Technology (cutting edge smartphone technology to capture Point-of-Emotion insights to gain unparalleled depth of responses).
Paid Product Testing is done from home 95% of the time, but very occasionally paid Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings. These visits are paid by the hour also.
There are times when the product testing may be discussed in a private chat room that is opened by the market research group.
Write reviews as requested in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule for each project.
Review requirements can vary, however, the standard requirement is a written review, photos of the reviewer with the product and a video review.

Requirements:
Great ability to follow precise instructions
Be open to write short reviews, record audio or short video (doesn't have to be perfect), no experience needed
Great attention to detail and curious spirit
Be able to work 15-20 hours per week and commit to a certain routine
Have access to a computer and a reliable internet connection
Have access to a digital camera or cellphone that takes pictures
Be honest and reliable
Good communication skills is an asset
No experience required
High School Diploma
18 years or older

items.title: Tutor Quality Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*About MyTutor:*

MyTutor is the UK’s leading platform for online tuition, and we’re on a mission to empower each learner with the expertise they need to reach their potential. Through our highly-engaged tutor community and smart, interactive Online Lesson Space, we envision a future where any student can access high quality one-to-one support.

With the growing demand for personalised education, tutoring has become a £2bn market in the UK alone. Against this backdrop, MyTutor has become one of the fastest-growing and best-funded EdTech businesses in Europe and we’re on our way to revolutionising the tutoring landscape. To date, we’ve worked with over 10,000 families, 350 schools and raised over £10m from a mix of respected institutional and angel investors.

We’re a friendly team of 40 in a shared office in Spitalfields. Some of the team have joined from Barclays, BCG, Goldman Sachs, Just Eat, JustGiving and General Assembly, and as a whole we’re proactive, close-knit and easy to get along with.

*About the role:*

You’ll join MyTutor with a remit to continually improve the quality of our tutor base, equipping our 10,000-strong community with the tools they need to deliver exceptional and impactful tuition. You’ll shape how we select our tutors, and how we support and train them on the platform.

*What you’ll do:*

* *You’ll be our expert on all things related to tutor quality.* You’ll regularly speak to tutors, parents and teachers to understand their pain points and you’ll turn these insights into a roadmap of initiatives and improvements. One month you might be creating content to support tutors with lesson planning; another month you could be working with our product team to support tutors to build professional-looking profiles.

* *You’ll ensure we’re selecting the strongest potential tutors from our talent pool.* You’ll manage our tutor interview process and assessment framework, as well as recruiting, training and managing our team of freelance, remote interviewers.

* *You’ll own our shiny new training programme for tutors.* You’ll build out our curriculum, identifying the next opportunities for training, and either commissioning the content or creating it yourself.

* *You’ll introduce quality metrics & QA processes* - working with our data team - so that we can confidently measure the quality of our tutor base and see the impact of your work.

*Requirements:*

* 2-4 years work experience, ideally teaching, working in an educational setting or in the EdTech space
* Confident turning insights into actions and managing a project from concept to delivery
* Enjoys motivating others, possibly with some experience of coaching or people management
* An appreciation of what makes our tutors tick - you’ll be able to demonstrate empathy for our tutors and understand what motivates them

*Benefits:*

* Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
* A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
* Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
* Training and investment in your learning
* Competitive salary and option package
* Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings
* 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: QA Test Engineer Manual to Auto - up to 40k -Remote and 10-4
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
QA Test Engineer (Manual Testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JIRA and Regression Testing) - BRISTOL - up to 40k - Flexitime (Core Hours 10-4), Remote working, Pension, Training, Regular socials, 24 days holiday, Cycle to work scheme, Career progression opportunities, High street vouchers, Life insurance 3 x salary, Private health care, Family feel, Christmas closure, yearly annual salary reviews and bonus.

Are you wanting to make the move from manual to automation testing? Or, are you already an automation tester wanting to be the driving force in leading a team to implementing full automated testing? Either or, I want to speak to you!

The Role

A unique and exciting opportunity has arisen for a QA Test Engineer (manual testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JRIA, regression) to join a highly established and well-known business in the Heart of Bristol, on their journey transforming and building bespoke software. Ultimately, the company are aiming to make the move over to automation testing altogether. This will provide you with an opportunity to learn automation testing together with the business, make a big impact on the company and even better develop yourself as a professional.

As a QA Test Engineer (manual testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JRIA, regression) you will be joining one of the web / platform teams within the company to evaluate, repair and rejuvenate the testing lifecycle. As the role of the QA Test Engineer (manual testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JRIA, regression) progresses you will then develop the testing process by working with other QA engineers and developers to make this process as integrated as possible. With a designated point of contact and a supportive team culture, you will be trained to deliver services in conjunction with the company processes. Within a diverse team in terms of skillset, you are sure to be constantly learning and evolving as a professional.

Part of the responsibilities of the QA Test Engineer(manual testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JRIA, regression) is to work in an agile, collaborative environment with developers and account managers to create the best multiple platform software for each of their clients. You will also analyse project requirements with Business Analysts and develop plans to mitigate the risks to system quality. Therefore you must have experience working closely with developers, BA Analysts and experience with in an agile environment. You should have experience of developing test plans for tasks, dependencies and participants, have robust testing setup experience and enforce all processes for testing in conjunction with company processes. You should have a track record of holding a high standard of quality throughout project processes and have experience reporting the progress in order to predict milestones. By taking on the role of QA Engineer (manual testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JRIA, regression) you will be a vital part of the companies future, therefore you must have drive, ambition and desire to be successful whilst having a diligent nature.

Role Requirements:

  • Manual testing (minimum 2 years)
  • Regression testing
  • Jira
  • Agile (Scrum)
  • Experience testing enterprise web/mobile applications
  • Be organised, robust, pay attention to detail, work autonomously and be flexible and pragmatic.

Desirables:

  • PHP / .Net knowledge
  • Experience working with test automation tools like Selenium etc.

The Company

Does a young and vibrant environment with nerf guns appeal to you?

My client prides themselves on being at the forefront of innovation and creativity- they are also highly proud of the investment that they make into their employees. Company culture is highly important to them and they are known for supporting people through times of need- whilst delivering fantastic solutions, getting the job done and expanding at a rapid pace. Due to their success, they are used globally by businesses and work hard to stay competitive in the market in which they deliver. As a result, their Developers are commercially aware and keep up to date with the news and continue to learn and develop. They are home to some of the most talented and inventive IT professionals that exist and nurture talent whilst providing opportunity with great training. With a family feel and supportive nature that runs through the office, it is no surprise that most employees are not only colleagues but friends. Regularly attending technology conferences and playing with innovative solutions, you will get the opportunity to be exposed to some exciting and creative projects whilst always being 'on top' of the latest technologies. The company have high staff retention rates, a 'family' feel environment and are known for having great scope in terms of career progression and growth- what they are looking for is someone to grow and thrive with them.

QA Test Engineer (Manual Testing, AGILE/Waterfall, JIRA and Regression Testing) - BRISTOL - up to 40k - Flexitime (Core Hours 10-4), Remote working, Pension, Training, Regular socials, 24 days holiday, Cycle to work scheme, Career progression opportunities, High street vouchers, Life insurance 3 x salary, Private health care, Family feel, Christmas closure, yearly annual salary reviews and bonus.

Oscar Technology Limited is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy at https://our-privacy-policy.

items.title: Waggl: Experienced Software Tester (QA)
items.content:
Experienced Software Tester (QA)

Waggl is looking for experienced Software Tester to join our growing team.

How we are different

We know that as a Software Tester you can work many places.  Waggl’s work environment is unique.

  • We care deeply about our work.  Both the quality of what we produce and its impact.
  • We believe everyone deserves to have their voice heard from a brand new hire to the CEO.  This is key to our product and our culture. We check titles at the door. 
  • We trust you.  You can work from home, in the office, or from an RV traveling across the country as long as you stay connected and get your work done.  We trust you to take the time off you feel you need to recharge and be your best. No questions asked.
  • We improve the work lives of hundreds of thousands of people around the world.
  • We work really smart.
  • We are growing like crazy.
  • All these things and more have led us to be named as one of the Best Places to Work by Inc magazine.

How we work

We work really hard to balance collaboration, autonomy, efficiency and high quality output.  We do this through informal interactions, short daily meetings, and efficient planning meetings.  Our team is made up of software testers, developers, and designers.  

Where you fit in

We are looking for someone to join our QA team and help us have the highest quality product in the most efficient way.  We are looking for them to contribute in the following ways:  

  • Manually test features as they are being worked on and give feedback to the team
  • Identify risks in team planning meetings
  • Contribute to the team's best practices and effectiveness.
  • Help teammates

Requirements

  • 3+ years testing web or mobile applications 
  • Normal work hours are EDT, CDT, or PDT, AST (e.g. you live in North America, Central America, or South America)
  • Experience with functional, exploratory and regression testing.
  • Experience working in Agile environments
  • Team player
  • Expert English if English is not your first language

Nice to have

  • Experience working remotely

Great ability to follow precise instructions
Be open to write short reviews, record audio or short video (doesn't have to be perfect), no experience needed
Great attention to detail and curious spirit
Be able to work 15-20 hours per week and commit to a certain routine
Have access to a computer and a reliable internet connection
Have access to a digital camera or cellphone that takes pictures
Be honest and reliable
Good communication skills is an asset
No experience required
High School Diploma
18 years or older

A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for an entry level opportunity or for seasonal work, temporary work or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible and no previous experience is necessary. Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistant. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker or intern who is looking for a flexible part time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. Also if you have been involved in accounting, clerical jobs, marketing, management, security or data entry jobs you may qualify for a paid product tester position.

Benefits:
Very competitive salary
Weekly pay
Work around your schedule
Learn about an exciting industry
Telecommute (you can work from home, work or school)
Most of the time you can keep the product tested
An incredible team comprised of motivated and talented individuals


To apply please follow this link:

items.title: Product Tester from Home (Part-time). No Exp. Required, $25-$45/hr. - Pontiac
items.content:
In-Home Usage Tester (Product Tester from home) Part-time

Presently we're recruiting Product Testers (from home) in several US cities to expand our private network of In-Home Usage Testers (IHUT) to fulfill upcoming contracts with national and international companies. We guarantee 15-20 hours per week with an hourly pay of between $25/hr. and $45/hr., depending on the In-Home Usage Test project. No experience required.
American Consumer Panels is a consulting firm that specializes in product testing and product development work. We design and conduct In-Home Usage Testing (IHUT) locally and nationally to provide actual user feedback to companies and market research firms to evaluate products, packaging, related product instructions and more.
We leverage our network of private panels (In-Home Usage Testers) to provide product testers to companies for evaluating the in-home experience with a wide variety of products to ensure proper product certification and greater market access.
Please note that although this job can be done from home 95% of the time, very occasionally In-Home Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings (visits are local and scheduled at no more than 20 minutes drive from the In-Home Usage Tester address). These optional visits are also paid by the hour.
During your application process, we will determine your consumer profile and establish what products would be suitable for you to test according to your demographics, lifestyle, consumer behavior, skills, hobbies and ability. Research questionnaires are used to identify and target certain types of consumers, to ensure the right participants are engaged and to achieve the representative sample needed. Job candidates for In-Home Usage Testing are also screened to meet the client s needs for the project to ensure that the product is one that they qualify to test and that they have a balance of demographics and attitudes.
Participation in these product testing and consumer panels is always free, secure and private. In-Home Usage Testing is a quick, easy and fun way to make extra cash by telling big brands what you think about their upcoming products and services in the American market.

Main duties:
Sign and return non-disclosure agreements before the product to be tested is shipped. Individuals who complete the required documents will have the products sent to their homes.
Once the product is received for In-Home Usage Test (IHUT), the Product Tester must take care of the product being tested and use it responsibly.
Read and strictly follow the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule provided with each product testing project. In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedules may include tasks to do such as: unpacking, reading instructions, journal entries, online or mobile feedback, usage of product for certain amount of time, writing reviews, taking pictures, etc.
Properly document In-Home Usage Test as instructed in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule. Types of documentation commonly used for In-Home Usage Tests are snapshots, audio recordings, videos and Product Journals.
Attend Skype meetings or conference call meetings with Account Managers, Brand Managers, Research Managers, Product Managers or small business owners to offer ongoing product usage feedback. These short virtual meetings may take place 2-3 times per week and are paid by the hour also.
Some In-Home Usage Tests projects may require participants to use MFour s Mobile In-Home Use Test Technology (cutting edge smartphone technology to capture Point-of-Emotion insights to gain unparalleled depth of responses).
Paid Product Testing is done from home 95% of the time, but very occasionally paid Product Testers may be asked to visit the client's office, laboratory, store, warehouse or factory for training or meetings. These visits are paid by the hour also.
There are times when the product testing may be discussed in a private chat room that is opened by the market research group.
Write reviews as requested in the In-Home Usage Test Daily Schedule for each project.
Review requirements can vary, however, the standard requirement is a written review, photos of the reviewer with the product and a video review.

Requirements:
Great ability to follow precise instructions
Be open to write short reviews, record audio or short video (doesn't have to be perfect), no experience needed
Great attention to detail and curious spirit
Be able to work 15-20 hours per week and commit to a certain routine
Have access to a computer and a reliable internet connection
Have access to a digital camera or cellphone that takes pictures
Be honest and reliable
Good communication skills is an asset
No experience required
High School Diploma
18 years or older

A paid Product Tester position is perfect for those looking for an entry level opportunity or for seasonal work, temporary work or part-time work. The hours are completely flexible and no previous experience is necessary. Our paid Product Testers come from all backgrounds and industries ranging from customer service and sales to administrative assistant. If you are a manager, receptionist, warehouse or factory worker, driver, medical assistant, nurse, cleaner, college student, messenger, maid, teacher, retail associate, salesperson, secretary, server, janitor, cashier, contract worker or intern who is looking for a flexible part time or seasonal job, you should try paid Product Testing to supplement your income. items.title: Remote Quality Assurance Manager - GCP
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Quality Assurance, GCP, QMS, CAPAs, ICH, FDA, EMEA, Clinical Research Organizations (CROs), CRO and clinical site audits

We are a clinical stage biopharm company founded in 2013. We are focused on developing and commercializing therapies to treat targeted patient populations suffering from serious diseases with a high unmet medical need.

We are looking for experienced individuals to join our team for a variety of roles. These roles are remote with excellent compensation packages.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- REMOTE opportunity
- Breakthrough therapies
- Great time to join the company

What You Will Be Doing

- Provide GCP compliance oversight of internal systems and processes as well as those of CROs, vendors, and clinical investigator sites.
- Plans and conducts internal GCP audits. Manages all audit findings and resulting CAPAs.
- Completes clinical site audits and vendor audits and manages all resulting CAPAs
- Develops QA procedures for the GCP Quality Management System and educates staff on its function and importance.
- Establishes metrics for the Quality Management System to identify trends.
- Provide input on all procedures to ensure compliance with applicable GCP and ICH regulations.
- Provide GCP training to staff, as required.
- Lead all departments internally/CRO/clinical sites to ensure inspection readiness.
- Completes required SOP training as identified by in training matrix.

What You Need for this Position

- BS Degree
- Extensive QA experience within the pharmaceutical field
- Good Clinical Practices (GCP) experience
- Supervisory/Management experience
- Knowledge of International guidance's and requirements.
- Ability/Willingness to travel 20% of the time.

What's In It for You

- Competitive Compensation and Benefits.
- REMOTESo, if you are a QA Manager with GCP experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.title: Software QA Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=26}
items.content:
Software QA Engineer

United States, California
Company: Zenni Optical

Overview

We are looking for a Software QA Engineer to be part of the web ecommerce IT team that develops and supports the zennioptical.com web app and related services. This position will be a valuable member of our team and is expected to provide competent level of technical support for ongoing development and maintenance of QA automation processes and activities. About you You will be responsible for testing Zenni’s web app using open source and subscription-based testing tools in a proactive way implementing best practices of QA automation industry. Tasks will include building, maintaining and executing automated jobs and test scripts, advising and recommending testing solutions and practices suitable for enterprise level ecommerce platform. The position requires a person who feels comfortable in diverse fast-pased environment, working creative way and is self-motivated. You have strong desire to learn and grow. You always looking for answers and figuring out how you can improve QA testing activities to result in better software quality. You can juggle multiple tasks and manage expectation at the same time. You are the connecting point between business and dev teams so effective communication and willignes to fully understand existing app structure as well as scope of new projects is a must. Essentials Duties Design and execute automated scripts using QA tools Develop, implement and maintain test environments, frameworks and systems Collaborate with developers to identify software defects and manage effectively Work with various teams to promote quality best practices Participate in the review of product design specifications and source code with other members of the engineering team, ensure the testability requirements are addressed in the design Collaborate with other teams including development, product management, business analysis and product support teams for successful delivery of new features Functional, regression, usability, performance, stress, load, security and other types of testing as needed Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of QA engineering and 5+ years of software QA experience. Fundamental understanding of SDLC, STLC, QA methodologies and approaches. Practical knowledge of programming language: C, C++, Java Experience with IntelliJ or Eclipse Experience with Maven Experience with version control systems (Git or similar) Proficient in Selenium Webdriver Profficient in designing/creating scalable, maintainable and effective automation frameworks Experience with performance and load testing (JMeter, Blaze Meter) Solid API testing skills Practical knowledge of BDD (Cucumber/Gherkin) Practical knowledge of CI/CD Jenkins In-depth understanding of responsive design, cross browser, cross platform, compatibility testing. TCM platforms: TestRail Bug reporting: Jira, Bugherd Requirements analysis: Confluence, Wiki, Creative Cloud, inVision etc. Web commerce industry experience and understanding enterprise level architecture a plus. Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or related field a plus. Strong project management skills; can change course if needed to get things done within short timeframes to meet aggressive deadlines Self-starter with ability to learn quickly; able to thrive in an exciting, fast-paced environment Collaborative team player with a positive outlook and “can-do” attitude Sound judgment; trustworthiness, strong personal integrity and work ethic

by Jobble

Apply for job

items.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=9, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=16, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Software Quality Assurance Analyst

Variphy

Variphy is looking to add a Quality Assurance Analyst to our growing, but tightly-knit product team. In this role, you will manually test new features and fixes to our core product, Variphy Insight, as well as work with our design, development, and field-support teams in documenting and reproducing issues found in our customers' environments.  We are looking for applicants who are extremely detail-oriented and have experience evaluating web content.


* This is a full time and 100% remote position for applicants based within the United States only.

* Bonus points if you live in Portland (OR), Vancouver (WA), Melbourne or Tampa (FL), St. Louis (MO), Chicago (IL), Dallas (TX), or San Francisco Bay Area (CA).  

* Sorry, but no freelancers, contractors, recruiter referrals, or applicants from outside the continental United States will be considered for this position.




As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will...



* Consistently and effectively provide the "human element" when testing the user experience, user interface, and functionality of our product

* Identify, create, and execute test plans as part of the software development life cycle and release process

* Replicate, document, and validate fixes for bugs and other application issues reported from the field

* Use and understand how different web browsers behave (e.g. does a page function differently in Internet Explorer 11 than it does in Firefox?)

* Help craft and execute test plans from user stories, bug reports, or sometimes loosely defined requirements 

* Expand our technical knowledge base by creating and improving how-to articles, videos, and user guides

* Create and maintain test data, tools, and utilities

* Travel (< 5%) for team meetups and events two to three times per year




Success in this role will mean...


* Effectively communicating both verbally and in writing to other remote team members

* Having an eye for detail and the ability to think like a user

* You are able to communicate your opinions tactfully, even when it's a "hard truth"

* You are a problem solver and are motivated to learn without the need for micro-management




We're looking for applicants that know or can learn...



* Atlassian Jira or a similar issue/bug tracking system

* How to test enterprise (B2B) software with web-based user interfaces

* User basics of both Linux (Ubuntu) and Windows operating systems

* The basics of deploying, configuring, and using Virtual Machines

* Networking basics (at least know what an IP address and port are)




You will set yourself apart from other applicants by having experience with...



* Basic SQL queries and a working knowledge of MySQL and Microsoft SQL Server

* The basics of a web or application server (such as Apache Tomcat)

* Scripting or programming (e.g. You've scripted or written code to automate something useful)

* Cloud/SAAS providers (like AWS, Digital Ocean, Azure, Google, Linode, etc.)

* Cisco Unified Communications/Collaboration

* Call Detail Records

items.content:
Data Warehouse Test Engineer at Altinity

Remote | International

We’re looking for an experienced engineer to develop and run tests on ClickHouse data warehouse, which Altinity helps develop and support.

We’ll expect you to design, develop, and run tests on the ClickHouse open source project on Github. Our team is particularly focused on topics like storage management, security, and datatypes but you can count on interesting QA/test problems involving all aspects of database behavior.

Required Skills:

  • Excellent coding skills in Python, C++, and/or Go
  • Experience in SQL as well as writing/running applications against SQL databases
  • Ability to design test cases and code them efficiently
  • A strong focus on product quality, including creative techniques to find and diagnose bugs
  • Familiarity with open source development including working with core committers to get pull requests approved and merged
  • Ability to work with others and independently
  • Strong oral and written English; Russian language a plus
  • Location: Remote work-from-home position anywhere from Eastern Europe to Western U.S.
  • Education: CS degree or equivalent experience

Job Type: Full-time

Apply for job

items.title: Tutor Quality Assurance Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*About MyTutor:*

MyTutor is the UK’s leading platform for online tuition, and we’re on a mission to empower each learner with the expertise they need to reach their potential. Through our highly-engaged tutor community and smart, interactive Online Lesson Space, we envision a future where any student can access high quality one-to-one support.

With the growing demand for personalised education, tutoring has become a £2bn market in the UK alone. Against this backdrop, MyTutor has become one of the fastest-growing and best-funded EdTech businesses in Europe and we’re on our way to revolutionising the tutoring landscape. To date, we’ve worked with over 10,000 families, 350 schools and raised over £10m from a mix of respected institutional and angel investors.

We’re a friendly team of 40 in a shared office in Spitalfields. Some of the team have joined from Barclays, BCG, Goldman Sachs, Just Eat, JustGiving and General Assembly, and as a whole we’re proactive, close-knit and easy to get along with.

*About the role:*

You’ll join MyTutor with a remit to continually improve the quality of our tutor base, equipping our 10,000-strong community with the tools they need to deliver exceptional and impactful tuition. You’ll shape how we select our tutors, and how we support and train them on the platform.

*What you’ll do:*

* *You’ll be our expert on all things related to tutor quality.* You’ll regularly speak to tutors, parents and teachers to understand their pain points and you’ll turn these insights into a roadmap of initiatives and improvements. One month you might be creating content to support tutors with lesson planning; another month you could be working with our product team to support tutors to build professional-looking profiles.

* *You’ll ensure we’re selecting the strongest potential tutors from our talent pool.* You’ll manage our tutor interview process and assessment framework, as well as recruiting, training and managing our team of freelance, remote interviewers.

* *You’ll own our shiny new training programme for tutors.* You’ll build out our curriculum, identifying the next opportunities for training, and either commissioning the content or creating it yourself.

* *You’ll introduce quality metrics & QA processes* - working with our data team - so that we can confidently measure the quality of our tutor base and see the impact of your work.

*Requirements:*

* 2-4 years work experience, ideally teaching or working in an educational setting
* Confident turning insights into actions and managing a project from concept to delivery
* Enjoys motivating others, possibly with some experience of coaching or people management
* An appreciation of what makes our tutors tick - you’ll be able to demonstrate empathy for our tutors and understand what motivates them

*Benefits:*

* Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
* A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
* Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
* Training and investment in your learning
* Competitive salary and option package
* Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings
* 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: Tutor Quality Assurance Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*About MyTutor:*

MyTutor is the UK’s leading platform for online tuition, and we’re on a mission to empower each learner with the expertise they need to reach their potential. Through our highly-engaged tutor community and smart, interactive Online Lesson Space, we envision a future where any student can access high quality one-to-one support.

With the growing demand for personalised education, tutoring has become a £2bn market in the UK alone. Against this backdrop, MyTutor has become one of the fastest-growing and best-funded EdTech businesses in Europe and we’re on our way to revolutionising the tutoring landscape. To date, we’ve worked with over 10,000 families, 350 schools and raised over £10m from a mix of respected institutional and angel investors.

We’re a friendly team of 40 in a shared office in Spitalfields. Some of the team have joined from Barclays, BCG, Goldman Sachs, Just Eat, JustGiving and General Assembly, and as a whole we’re proactive, close-knit and easy to get along with.

*About the role:*

You’ll join MyTutor with a remit to continually improve the quality of our tutor base, equipping our 10,000-strong community with the tools they need to deliver exceptional and impactful tuition. You’ll shape how we select our tutors, and how we support and train them on the platform.

*What you’ll do:*

* *You’ll be our expert on all things related to tutor quality.* You’ll regularly speak to tutors, parents and teachers to understand their pain points and you’ll turn these insights into a roadmap of initiatives and improvements. One month you might be creating content to support tutors with lesson planning; another month you could be working with our product team to support tutors to build professional-looking profiles.

* *You’ll ensure we’re selecting the strongest potential tutors from our talent pool.* You’ll manage our tutor interview process and assessment framework, as well as recruiting, training and managing our team of freelance, remote interviewers.

* *You’ll own our shiny new training programme for tutors.* You’ll build out our curriculum, identifying the next opportunities for training, and either commissioning the content or creating it yourself.

* *You’ll introduce quality metrics & QA processes* - working with our data team - so that we can confidently measure the quality of our tutor base and see the impact of your work.

*Requirements:*

* 2-4 years work experience, ideally teaching or working in an educational setting
* Confident turning insights into actions and managing a project from concept to delivery
* Enjoys motivating others, with experience of leading a team
* An appreciation of what makes our tutors tick - you’ll be able to demonstrate empathy for our tutors and understand what motivates them

*Benefits:*

* Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
* A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
* Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
* Training and investment in your learning
* Competitive salary and option package
* Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings
* 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

    • At Visable Labs we strive to connect demand and supply in the digitized B2B world. As a laboratory for innovative solutions in tech, product and marketing we help purchasers to stay ahead of the game on all platforms of the Visable Group. With a reach of more than 3.7 million B2B purchasers per month, the Visable Group is operating the leading B2B marketplaces in the D-A-CH region “Wer liefert was” (wlw) as well as the European B2B platform EUROPAGES in 26 countries. As part of the Visable Group, we are backed up by a proven business and as a separate entity, we work in cross functional teams, agile and at full speed like a startup. Our headquarter´s in Hamburg and offices in Berlin and Paris make us a truly European company.

    We provide you with challenges.

    • Provide functional and integration quality-assurance testing for features delivered on Web and backend applications
    • Work closely with multi-functional organizations, project teams and clients to develop project schedules, execute test plans and cases, and deliver high quality products
    • Act as a strong advocate for quality in the product development process for software engineering
    • Supply initiatives to improve the overall QA process, such as identifying gaps or inefficiencies in workflows and suggesting improvements
    • Self-motivated and able to grasp issues quickly and make educated, critical judgment in the absence of complete requirements
    • Provide project managers with timely and accurate QA status and progress during all project testing phases.
    • Able to multi-task in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

    We provide you with perspectives.

    • The opportunity to shape the future of online B2B business and build a European champion
    • A multinational team with diverse backgrounds and languages
    • An experienced management team of serial entrepreneurs who know how to build a fun, fair and successful company
    • Regular team events, team breakfast, Mate, coffee & tea, snacks and much more
    • A spacious, contemporary and bright office in the heart of Kreuzberg
    • The ability to unplug from the office desk and work remotely from wherever you want twice a month
    • A furry feel good manager (our Golden Retriever girl “Coco”)
    • And lastly, an ego-less, product-focused working environment

    And that’s what you should bring with you.

    • 3 or more years of professional work experience in software QA or engineering
    • Experience automating functional & integration testing of Web and backend services & applications
    • Experience testing in Java, Ruby and Web Services (Rest & SOAP) environments
    • Experience in QA for scalable, distributed and high performance platforms
    • Excellent knowledge of QA automation architecture, methodologies, processes, and tools
    • Experience with Continuous Integration (CI), DevOps and setting up QA environments
    • Ability to work in an energizing environment with frequent context switching
    • Self-motivated, independent, and dedicated
    • Extraordinary collaboration and organizational skills
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Order description:
We are looking for a senior (or experienced medior) tester for IBS Sales Tax. The work will mainly be performed for Mini One Stop Shop. You are expected to participate as a full team member in the Scrum process. Together with your colleagues you work on the entire process: from refinement of the assignment, budgeting and scheduling the tasks, building and testing to demonstrating the functionality provided. The main focus is on the test activities (including automated testing), which you work on together with fellow testers. Sharing and recording knowledge is a matter of course.

order:
The IBS Turnover Tax is responsible for advisory management, architecture, design, construction, test, integration, (user) documentation and the implementation delivery of the adjusted business processes and information provision. own teams of IBS OB, STS, GBS and interfaces within IBS. IBS Turnover Tax coordinates the architecture, directs the realization and planning via the release train and provides the assignments to the interfaces. IBS OB takes the lead in testing across the components and coordinates with product management on prioritization and implementation and release moments. The sales tax chain faces major challenges in the coming years. European and national laws and regulations are developing strongly. In addition, the application landscape is very outdated. In order to be able to continue to comply with current and new legislation and regulations, the application landscape will have to be modernized, using state-of-the-art architecture principles and technologies. In doing so, a constant trade-off must be made between being able to meet business requirements on time and the realization of a robust and agile application landscape.

Requirements:
2 years of experience as a Java tester
2 years of experience working according to SAFe
2 years XML/XSD, Scripting, Test Automation, TMAP, ISTQB
Test organization and execution

To wish:
Professional and professional as a tester stands for his/her profession and has the drive to deliver a high-quality product
Change-oriented and creative: someone who easily dares to step into something new or to explore a new path.
Assertive personality with a critical eye and a solution-oriented, collaborative mentality
Knowledge of Angular, SQL, Jira/Confluence, Protract
Knowledge of Web/Java, Web services (soap), Jenkins, SOAP UI
Experience with Jira and Confluence
DB2

items.content:
Manual QA Tester at ColorElephant

Remote | International

About the position

We are growing and looking to recruit for our remote team an experienced QA Manual Tester to help us do manual testing of the applications we develop on top of the existing automatic tests.

You’ll work alongside other (remote) developers and testers that will support us in the creation of flawless websites and applications;

Position’s responsibilities are:

  • Understand fully the scope of the project and its intended functionality;
  • Get familiar with user stories and go beyond them;
  • Collaborate with project team members to define testing scope and approach;
  • Develop a test checklist for a project that describes test actions for all stakeholders / personas.
  • Execute test cases for assigned project work;
  • Submit detailed defects identified during the testing process; verify the bugs when they are resolved;
  • Report test results, status, concerns, and risks;
  • Conduct post-production release testing
  • Understand and support both website, mobile, and accessibility standards for testing
  • Stay informed about industry best practices;
  • Communicate with others, including project managers, on struggles and progress of each of the projects;
  • Help us refine and improve our QA process:

QA Tester requirements are:

  • 3+ years’ experience of working in a QA or similar role;
  • Basic technical knowledge is desired but not mandatory;
  • Great communication skills;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, effectively communicating issues and resolutions
  • Knowledge of prioritizing projects and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment with aggressive deadlines
  • Highly motivated and works with minimum supervision and remote location.
  • All of these things people ask for: motivated, focused, hard-worker that likes to grow and learn more, that works well with others and has a positive attitude;

Our Offer

  • Work from anywhere with our remote policy. We know sometimes the best work is done in the beach (or mountain, or… )
  • Competitive Salary for position and location
  • Health Plan and/or Deductions
  • Flexible vacation/days off policy
  • Training / Self-Development Yearly Package
  • Yearly Bonuses Program
  • Paid parental leave / Flexible conditions on return
  • Continuous Training (both on site and online)
  • Attend Annual Company retreat abroad
  • Ability to work in complex projects of Fortune500 as well as small companies.
  • Plenty of Growth Opportunities
  • A lot of ownership on projects working in key areas or full projects;
  • Support of a Project Manager in all work developed;
  • The opportunity to join an unique and growing company with a 200% growth record for the past 3 years;
  • Contribute with your suggestions and see your feedback and opinion impact products used by millions worldwide
  • A growing team full of talent;
Apply for job

items.title: Quality Assurance Testing Manager
items.content:
Quality Assurance Testing Manager at FIS

Remote
  • Job ID #: JR79179
  • Functional Area: Product Development
  • Position Type: Full-Time Regular
  • Experience Desired: At least 5 years
  • Education Desired: Bachelors Degree or equivalent
  • Primary Location: US-Arkansas-Little Rock 4001 N. Rodney Parham Rd-1170
  • Secondary Location(s): Remote – Anywhere In USA
  • Travel Percentage: 0.00

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.

About the team

FIS AutoSuite is a comprehensive set of systems and services for the automotive finance marketplace. One component is Automotive Finance. It operates in both domestic and international markets, enabling clients to address country-specific business requirements while maintaining the financial benefits of a single solution.

What you will be doing

GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provides guidance in the preparation of technical appraisals of programming languages and systems, computational software and related technology.
  • May oversee integration of computers in overall functions of scientific computation, data acquisition transmission and processing.
  • Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.
  • Conducts internal studies and/or audits on client and product development/engineering or operations team activities to evaluate if processes and deliverables fulfill requirements for quality, to uncover errors or deficiencies in processes and deliverables and to identify strengths and opportunities for improvement; studies and audits include issues such as profitability, productivity and quality.
  • Manages and/or participates in overall audit process.
  • Monitors applicable business unit work to ensure consistency and compliance with standard processes.
  • Contributes to the tactical and strategic planning for future quality programs.
  • Stays current with process-related industry standards.
  • Communicates quality information throughout the organization.
  • Supports development and delivery of training in quality matters.
  • Leads and mentors quality assurance team members.

What you bring:

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Thorough knowledge and use of process improvement and quality management methods, tools and technology used to create and support defect-free, application software or business operations processes for which the quality program will be focused
  • Considerable knowledge and qualification in company’s standard processes and one or more best practices quality approaches, e.g., CMMI, ISO, six sigma, total quality measurement
  • Thorough knowledge and experience conducting risk analyses, quality assessments, audits and/or studies and implementing successful process improvement programs
  • Considerable knowledge of the basic principles, processes, phases and roles of application development methodologies and software development life cycles (SDLC)
  • Considerable knowledge of the software applications, business operations and processes used within the division
  • Skill in understanding client’s needs, establishing credibility and building client relationships
  • Considerable skill in analysis, solid decision-making and problem solving
  • Skill in basic statistics
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others to achieve the company and project goals
  • Ability to influence and motivate clients and employees
  • Ability to succeed in an agile work environment where cross-functional teams work closely together to ensure requirements are met or exceeded
  • Ability to demonstrate interpersonal and teambuilding skills, working with technical and non-technical individuals

Preferred Experience:

  • In-depth Knowledge and Experience with Automated Testing Tools (i.e. Selenium)
  • Solid experience managing a QA team within a Large-Scale software organization using Functional and Performance Automated Testing disciplines within both Mainframe & Client-Server environments
  • Experience managing an Off-Shore Testing Team
  • Business and Technical Skills to serve as a mentor/director for team activities
  • Ability/Experience identifying industry trends around testing products and methodologies
  • Ability to communicate with executive leadership on projects/status updates
  • Experience managing P&L for an individual business line with a budget >$1mm.

What we offer you

  • A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
  • A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
  • A competitive salary and benefits
  • A variety of career development tools, resources and opportunities

With a 50-year history rooted in the financial services industry, FIS™ is the world’s largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions. We champion clients from banking to capital markets, retail to corporate and everything touched by financial services. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, our 53,000 worldwide employees help serve more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries. Our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index.

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the FIS Online Privacy Notice.

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

For positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

As part of the selection process this role may require an assessment to determine suitability

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Apply for job

Job description

Aptera is seeking an experienced QA Analyst to join our tight-knit, progressive and growing agile development team. As a QA Analyst, you will be a part of the Quality Assurance team, dedicated to testing the design, functionality and compliance of websites, web applications and mobile applications. If you are a stickler for details and love perfecting user experience, then we would like to chat with you!

Top reasons to join Aptera

  • Grow through investment
    • Personal mentorship, attend conferences and trainings, company outings, team building events and more
  • Exposure to different industries
    • Manufacturing and retail to healthcare and finance
  • Push your skill set to the next level
    • Work alongside passionate, cutting edge technologists, who challenge and inspire you to grow
  • Relaxed work environment and culture
    • Casual attire in the office and an open, collaborative workspace
  • Remote-Friendly Culture
    • Collaboration Tools (Zoom, Slack, Visual Studio Live Share, etc.)
    • Flexible work schedules
    • Remote-first meetings
    • Pair and mob-testing sessions
    • Remote employees are always invited to come take advantage of our headquarters at any time
  • Excellent pay and benefits
    • 401K, Health, Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Life Insurance

Top things we look for in our team members

  • “Team over self” mentality
  • People smarts
  • Eye for detail
  • Polished & professional
  • Goes the extra mile
  • Always willing to learn new things

Top skills/qualifications we look for

  • Associates or Bachelor’s degree
  • 1 + year experience testing quality of web content, web applications, mobile applications, functionality, design, and UX
  • Familiar with UI/UX design best practices and mobile-first design
  • In-depth knowledge of web-based technologies and content management systems
  • Experience exercising exceptionally high attention to detail in testing applications
  • Understanding of automated testing preferred
  • Website SEO and ADA compliance experience preferred

As a QA Analyst you will

  • Participate in client discoveries and provide user feedback and recommendations to clients
  • Develop and execute manual tests to ensure development projects meet the established criteria for acceptance
  • Review projects for alignment with design standards, SEO best practices, and appropriate CMS (content management system) formatting
  • Ensure websites and applications work as expected on multiple browsers, platforms and devices
  • Find root causes of problems, recognize recurring issues, and contribute to the resolution process
  • Coordinate efforts as part of a web and mobile application development team to identify performance opportunities and design issues, as well as to ensure testability issues are addressed during design life cycle
  • Develop new and refine existing QA processes, tools, and testing infrastructure to enhance quality and productivity
  • Consider UI/UX and whether features align with design best practices
  • Log bugs / issues with appropriate detail, setting to the appropriate severity level
  • Practice continuous improvement techniques using industry standard practices and tooling
  • Provide mentoring as needed to more junior members of the team

Aptera works with clients across the globe and is headquartered in Fort Wayne, IN. For additional information about Aptera please visit our website at www.apterainc.com. 

Apply now

About Aptera Software

Aptera is a custom software development partner specializing in building mobile apps, web apps, and websites for enterprise-level businesses. Founded in 2003 and based in Fort Wayne, IN, we have a diverse team of onsite and remote employees around the Midwest.  At Aptera, we believe that by creating a culture of learning we can empower our team members to develop the best software for our clients. With our expertise, we help clients solve complex business problems to transform the way they do business.

Technologies

automated-tests
integration-testing
testing

Dan Wash 1
Brian Abent
Aaron Wood
Graham Daley Quality Assurance Specialist 1

Job description

Company Overview

Ceros is an experiential content platform that empowers the creation of bespoke, immersive digital content without code. We’re passionate about helping companies transform their static digital content into engaging experiences. From custom interactive microcontent, to immersive event microsites, you can build it with Ceros. Publish and update live content instantly, and embed it into your site instantly. Join us in ending the endless creation of static content and be part of the movement towards meaningful content experiences.

We are well-funded and venture-backed by prominent investors including Grotech Ventures, Greycroft, and Starvest Partners.

About the Team

Designing and building the Ceros platform is not easy. We require the best-of-the-best developers, designers, and QA testers, ready to bring the functionality of desktop design software to the web, often pushing browsers to the limits of what’s currently possible.

As part of the Ceros product team, you’ll be working in a small, cross-functional group with the most talented people you’ve ever worked with. We hire only passionate and creative people with a proven and unquestionable ability to execute. Every member of the team is equally responsible for moving the product forward.

We have a dynamic company culture that collaborates daily. We care deeply about the user experience, and we debate passionately about our ideas. When you work at Ceros, you check your ego at the door, and you aren’t afraid to be honest, especially to yourself. We take our jobs seriously but ourselves not so much -- whether it’s cracking jokes in the chat room or poking fun at the CEO’s atrocious spelling.

This position is 100% remote, but we are primarily in US Eastern time zone and prefer candidates who can have an overlapping work schedule with the rest of the team.

About the Job

Affectionately referred to internally as “The Day-Ruiners”, our QA specialists work side by side with developers and designers to ensure product excellence. We’re looking for a QE Lead to drive the definition and evolution of QE processes, as well as automation, to optimize efficiency and quality while meeting the demands of rapid growth. The perfect candidate should have strong, quality engineering experience in agile environments, and team leadership skills.

Day to day responsibilities include ensuring that our QA team runs as efficient as possible, testing new features, writing and maintaining automated tests, working with our support team to triage and document defects found in production, and assisting with releases. You should have previous experience testing web applications and know where things can break down. Proficiency using browser developer tools and being comfortable with the command line is also a must. Most importantly, you need to care deeply about our customers and their experience working with us.

Working from home, you’ll be communicating often through chat rooms, email, and video conferencing. We offer flexible working hours and an extremely flexible vacation policy. And we provide excellent gear (15” Macbook Pro, iPad, external monitor, etc.).

As a quality assurance lead, your typical day-to-day involves:

  • Taking ownership of the QE process and overall testing of our product
  • Lead the Quality Engineering teams to define and execute efficient QA tools & frameworks
  • Establishing best practices for the QA team as a whole
  • Developing and refining QE processes to ensure testing runs as efficiently as possible, without sacrificing product quality
  • Designing robust test plans and strategies for features
  • Monitoring product and/or feature-level quality health metrics (testability, test health, test coverage, etc.)
  • Troubleshooting production issues
  • Facilitating communication across multiple agile teams
  • Presenting an aggregate view of testing to management
  • Personal support, mentoring, and professional development for testers
  • Developing and maintaining our automated testing suite
  • Testing stories to make certain we are producing the highest quality product
  • Testing for performance, security and resiliency
  • Identifying needs and process improvements and take the initiative to implement changes

Requirements

  • 4 years experience in a Senior/Lead quality engineering role, with an in-depth understanding of software engineering and development lifecycles, continuous integration, and agile-centric quality practices
  • Proven track record in quality engineering, both manual and automation
  • Strong leadership and managerial skills
  • Experience testing single page web applications across multiple browsers and devices - both automated and manual
  • Experience with continuous delivery
  • Experience with performance testing tools
  • Knowledge of containers and cloud services
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Fluent with at least one scripting language

Next Steps

If you’re interested in being part of the Ceros team, please send your resume and a cover letter to us. We’re a company of passionate, honest, and sometimes silly people, so please express yourself.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Flexible Vacation Policy
  • Health Insurance
  • Enjoy Your Work
  • Flexible Hours
  • Top-notch Gear
  • Stock Options
  • Work 100% From Home
  • Team meet-ups 3x/year

We are looking for experienced individuals to join our team for a variety of roles. These roles are remote with excellent compensation packages. Top Reasons to Work with Us - REMOTE opportunity - Breakthrough therapies - Great time to join the company What You Will Be Doing - Provide GCP compliance oversight of internal systems and processes as well as those of CROs, vendors, and clinical investigator sites. - Plans and conducts internal GCP audits.
